lesson.title: Practice Project Select Location of a New Pet Store
lesson.summary: A pet store chain is selecting the location for its next store. Build a predictive model to select the best location.

atoms.text:
## Practice Project Overview

This project is a continuation of the Create an Analytical Dataset project regarding trying to find the best city to expand for Pawdacity's newest pet store.  It will not be reviewed, but is here to give you some additional practice.

### Scenario

Pawdacity is a leading pet store chain in Wyoming with 13 stores throughout the state.  This year, Pawdacity would like to expand and open a 14th store. Your manager has asked you to perform an analysis to recommend the city for Pawdacity’s newest store, based on predicted yearly sales.

#### How Do I Complete this Project?

This project uses skills learned throughout the "Multivariable Linear Regression” lesson. To complete this project:

* Go through the course
* Apply the skills learned in the course to solve the business problem given in the project details section. 
* Use our guidelines and rubric to help build your project.
* When you're ready, submit it to us for review using the submission template found in the supporting materials section.

#### Skills Required

In order to complete this project, you must be able to:

* [Choose appropriate predictor variables](https://classroom.udacity.com/nanodegrees/nd008t-ent/parts/ec4b7a7b-1694-4c0c-bfed-224d0733896c/modules/13c582f8-2d91-4eb2-ab81-62f6bdd7ff53/lessons/983ffbba-8e41-4588-880d-d2a36210d7f5/concepts/28aebfa2-68a0-4125-b4a6-5183b0f0e415)
* [Analyze for correlations](https://classroom.udacity.com/nanodegrees/nd008t-ent/parts/ec4b7a7b-1694-4c0c-bfed-224d0733896c/modules/13c582f8-2d91-4eb2-ab81-62f6bdd7ff53/lessons/983ffbba-8e41-4588-880d-d2a36210d7f5/concepts/26f70b25-a280-4275-89e3-f36ee2b6bd0a) between predictor variables
* [Build a linear model](https://classroom.udacity.com/nanodegrees/nd008t-ent/parts/67b7a57e-f582-44d4-b814-c77b8b4b2ed7/modules/6c98f7f3-cfca-4b45-b7b5-39a6dab074aa/lessons/1b809e89-e2c7-46f8-8344-8bd093f929f6/concepts/cd0c2143-7268-4c76-8cf5-310be222da59)

### The Business Problem

Pawdacity is a leading pet store chain in Wyoming with 13 stores throughout the state.  This year, Pawdacity would like to expand and open a 14th store. Your manager has asked you to perform an analysis to recommend the city for Pawdacity’s newest store, based on predicted yearly sales.

In the first part, you've already cleaned up the dataset and dealt with outliers. 

In this project, you will take this dataset that you cleaned up and use this dataset to train a linear regression model in order to predict sales 

Here are the criterias given to you in choosing the right city:

1. The new store should be located in a new city. That means there should be no existing stores in the new city.
2. The total sales for the entire competition in the new city should be less than $500,000
3. The new city where you want to build your new store must have a population over 4,000 people (based upon the 2014 US Census estimate).
4. The predicted yearly sales must be over $200,000.
5. The city chosen has the highest predicted sales from the predicted set.

### Steps to Success

#### Step 1: Build a Linear Regression Model

Analyze the dataset you created in Project 2.1 and look at the distribution of your data. You can create histograms to look at each of your continuous and categorical data to determine the nature of the data you’re working with.

**Important:** You should have **10 rows** of data before you begin modeling the dataset. The correct answers will assume that you removed **Gillette** from the dataset. If you decided to remove a different outlier in P2.1, you will have to adjust your dataset for this project.

Build a linear regression model to help you predict total sales.

#### Step 2: Perform the Analysis

Use your regression model to calculate predicted sales for all of the cities and use the criteria given to you to make a recommendation.

### Review This project was formerly was a required project, so you can use the [project rubric](https://review.udacity.com/#!/rubrics/381/view) to review your project. If you are happy with your work, take a look at the solution material. If you see room for improvement, keep working to improve your project. ### Completion Template Use the completion template below to complete your project. (If you cannot access the Google doc, you can download a .docx or a .pdf version below.)
#### Data Please refer to the Supporting Materials section in the Creating an Analytical Dataset to access the data you need to complete this project.

# Practice Project Solution

The following resources can help you understand one possible solution to this project.

* [Project Answer Key](https://s3.amazonaws.com/video.udacity-data.com/topher/2018/June/5b157e30_p2.2-answer-key.docx/p2.2-answer-key.docx.pdf): This is a full write up of the answer, including explanations of the data cleaning process. (You can access a Google doc version [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/10KplfeV8uyM4prm7ioJOXvDpm-l1voCeLAaySclRnUU/edit).)
* [Solution Alteryx Workflow](https://d17h27t6h515a5.cloudfront.net/topher/2017/April/58f8d770_selectlocation-solutionworkflow/selectlocation-solutionworkflow.zip): This shows how all the analysis that led to the conclusions in the Project Answer Key.

You will need to connect your cleaned data into this workflow as a yxdb file and you will need to reconnect the demographics file. Also the workflow might have errors at first that should resolve after running thr workflow with the new data 2 times. The Association Analysis tool will error out most likely because you will need to reset the Target to the appropriate variable.
